question: Who among the following leaders unsuccessfully introduced a Bill in the Imperial legislative Council to make compulsory primary education for children of 6-10 years in the British Era?
explanation: Gopal Krishna Gokhale was a social reformer as well as a political leader during the time of Indian Independence Movement. He is also the founder of the Servants of India Society. In the year 1902, he became a non-official member of the British Imperial Legislative Council. Being a member of the Legislative Council Gokhale tried to introduce a proposal for compulsory primary education in 1910.
